alert.note: Alert for Amherst; Appomattox; Bedford; Campbell; City of Lynchburg (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued July 15 at 11:18PM EDT until July 16 at 5:30AM EDT by NWS Blacksburg
info.description: The National Weather Service in Blacksburg has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... Southern Amherst County in central Virginia... Northwestern Appomattox County in central Virginia... Northwestern Campbell County in central Virginia... The City of Lynchburg in central Virginia... Northeastern Bedford County in south central Virginia... * Until 530 AM EDT Sunday. * At 1118 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Between 2 and 5 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Life threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Life threatening flash flooding of creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Lynchburg... Bedford... Amherst... Forest... Big Island... Evington... Boonsboro... This includes the following locations... Liberty University, The National D-Day Memorial and Lynchburg Airport. This includes the following streams and drainages... Big Otter River, Blackwater Creek, Allens Creek and Bold Branch. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Move to higher ground now. Act quickly to protect your life. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads. When it is safe to do so, please send your reports of flooding, including mudslides or flooded roads, to the National Weather Service by calling toll free at 1...8 6 6...2 1 5...4 3 2 4. Reports and pictures can also be shared on the National Weather Service Blacksburg Facebook page and on Twitter.
